title: 112_s2130
content: The "Veterans Conservation Corps Authorization Act" defines terms like "corps" and "eligible veteran" and establishes the veterans conservation corps under the Secretary of the Interior. The Secretary, in cooperation with the Secretary of Veterans Affairs and the Secretary of Commerce, shall establish a veterans conservation corps to provide training and employment to eligible veterans, assist them in transitioning to civilian life, and help maintain Federal land and water. Eligible veterans will be employed for a 1-year period with the possibility of extension on a case-by-case basis. The Secretary may establish a program for short-term employment of student veterans attending higher education institutions, with employment not exceeding 16 weeks. Eligible veterans employed by the corps will receive a stipend and living allowance determined by the Secretary in consultation with the Secretary of Veteran Affairs. Each eligible veteran employed under subsection (b)(1) will be assigned to a work project that furthers the purposes described in subsection (a) and falls within categories such as transportation improvements, erosion control, landscape and recreation, habitat protection and restoration, data collection, and other specific project categories identified. The Secretary and the Secretary of Commerce will identify additional project categories within 180 days of the Act's enactment to further the purposes described. Eligible veterans in the corps will be assigned to projects that allow them to utilize their military skills. The Secretaries will develop and supervise work projects related to their respective jurisdictions. The Secretary, in collaboration with the Secretary of Veterans Affairs and the Secretary of Commerce, will establish a program within the corps to provide education and training to eligible veterans for their assigned work projects. Existing federal facilities will be utilized for this purpose.
